column2: Premise of the project in one simple phrase!
The Human Brain Project aims to allow scientific and industrial researchers to advance the knowledge in the fields of neuroscience, computing, and brain-related medicine
column14: the website is accessible and organised, parterships are open to everyone willing to contibute, the community is diverse across Europe (students, teachers, researchers..), these studies can lead to a massive posistive impact in medicine
column15: we don't have access to the data used in the publications, we can access some tools but still not transparent enough

column2: Worldwide network of scientists sorting fact from fiction in science based media coverage in order to help readers know which news to trust.
Open source project dedicated to provide open access to world's first virtual organism
column14: Very innovative project. It's a very innovative idea to create the world's first virtual organism to understand other complex systems such as the human brain
column15: Some concepts and terms are hard to understand for people who are not well-versed in coding. There are not many publications.

column2: NGO collecting data on environmental radiation and Air Quality
column14: The website is organized and detailes, it's easy to understand who are the people behind the work, it's easy to understand the stakeholders? the information in extremely useful for public and researchers.

column2: Creating tools for digital education, citizen science and environmental monitoring
column14: All code is avaible through github, the idea is to construct a hub of climate change datas avaible to everyone
column15: Actual senseboxes are quite expensive, website is mostly in german, as most publications are fully in german I guess that the articles weren't published  in internationnal journals
